1.verse: My breath is corrupt, my days are extinct, the graves are ready for me.

2.verse: Are there not mockers with me? and doth not mine eye continue in their provocation?

3.verse: Lay down now, put me in a surety with thee; who is he that will strike hands with me?

4.verse: For thou hast hid their heart from understanding: therefore shalt thou not exalt them.

5.verse: He that speaketh flattery to his friends, even the eyes of his children shall fail.

6.verse: He hath made me also a byword of the people; and aforetime I was as a tabret.

7.verse: Mine eye also is dim by reason of sorrow, and all my members are as a shadow.

8.verse: Upright men shall be astonied at this, and the innocent shall stir up himself against the hypocrite.

9.verse: The righteous also shall hold on his way, and he that hath clean hands shall be stronger and stronger.

10.verse: But as for you all, do ye return, and come now: for I cannot find one wise man among you.

11.verse: My days are past, my purposes are broken off, even the thoughts of my heart.

12.verse: They change the night into day: the light is short because of darkness.

13.verse: If I wait, the grave is mine house: I have made my bed in the darkness.

14.verse: I have said to corruption, Thou art my father: to the worm, Thou art my mother, and my sister.

15.verse: And where is now my hope? as for my hope, who shall see it?

16.verse: They shall go down to the bars of the pit, when our rest together is in the dust.
